name: Vibe Hotel Gold Coast

reviews.title: Good experience
reviews.text: We are a family of 3 and we arrived late at night. We had a triple room - the room was decent though the connecting door to the next room was pretty thin and we could hear lots of conversation from the next room. the location of the hotel is fabulous! Cavil avenue is just a short walk away and so's the beach. The theme parks were accessible by bus, the bus stops very close. The staff at the hotel were all very helpful whenever we had a query. Internet costs a bomb so avoided that. We stayed for 6 nights and would recommend this hotel to other travellers.
My partner and I stayed at the Vibe from 27th-30th Oct with a 19 month old child.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a king room with a bath which was great. The bed slightly on the firm side but once we lay there for a while it wasnt all that bad at all. We were on the 18th floor with a view from the front of the hotel which was breathtaking, looking out over the chevron towers and out at the ocean.
reviews.title: honeymoon let down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is BRILLIANT! Such a short stroll to Cavill Ave, the bus stop is a couple steps from the front door.
reviews.title: Well positioned

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had bar meals one night for "happy hour" which is during 5 and 7pm. you get a meal and a drink combo. beer/wine/basic spirit. The food is good, its not supposed to be restaurant quality obviously. We ordered fish and chips with salad and steak sandwiches with chips on the side with our drinks.
reviews.title: Excellent location!

reviews.text: Spent a few days here last week, whilst spending 10 days hopping around Australia. Didn't know it was Schoolies when we had booked the hotel, but never had any issues with them thankfully!
reviews.title: Great location, decent view, no frills

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was perfect, not too far from the beach, restaurants, bars, etc, but just far enough so you didn't have all the noise. Close to the bus stop which was great
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: We were on the 15th floor, with a great view! This is definitely a no frills hotel though. The 20min of wifi (lobby only) is a pain, we stayed in hostels that offered unlimited free wifi, and when that is your only way of communicating with people back home it just gets annoying with the tiny time allotment!
reviews.title: Excellent Location ~ Beach, Buses & Shops etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is good, nice and close to everything where you can just walk around.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: We do have some negative feedback, It is a big high to charge $8 per night car parking we thought and the car park is definitely not designed for big cars, was hard to move around.
reviews.title: True to its billing good value

reviews.text: I want to personally say thank you to all the helpful and friendly staff at the Vibe Hotel Gold Coast. 5 Stars in my book. I was almost going to request to stay for another 3 more days. Except for the fact that we had to come back to Adelaide due to our commitments back home. Breakfast was good and easy access and arrangements for theme parks, tourist attractions and transport. I want to personally say thank you Anastasia for her warm and friendly customer service. You are an asset to Vibe. Hope you come and visit Adelaide one day Anastasia.
reviews.title: Best Holiday in a long time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a Jet Boat Getaway Package at Vibe. The package is great value for money as you get two tickets for a jet boat ride (which was fantastic), one night's accommodation, breakfast and a late check out. The hotel is situated in a good location and it easy to walk to anywhere around Surfers Paradise including the beach. Hotel staff varied, when checking in we didn't receive the friendliest welcome, however the food and beverage staff were excellent. The pool is great and breakfast at curve and drinks served at the pool bar were fantastic. The rooms are spacious and of a reasonable standard. Just be aware they charge extra for parking ($8). Overall a good place to stay.
reviews.title: A Good Stay!

reviews.text: Hotel staffs very friendly and helpful. booked a few tours via the Hotel.
reviews.title: Thumb ups.

reviews.text: Hotel is well located with a supermarket (Woolworth) within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great location, but tired and ageing rooms

reviews.text: Many retail outlets too.
reviews.title: Clean, good location, nice views
Liked
reviews.text: Just got back from an overnight stay. Was given an upgrade to a studio room (with kitchenette) on check in which was great. The dude at the counter was awesome, fast and hassle-free. Loved the balcony, gotta have a balcony on surfers yea! The view was just lovely and I like how the location of the hotel is relatively quiet, no noisy crowds. Room was pretty nice for its price too, I just appreciated the good bed, especially in comparison to the more expensive accommodation nearby. I liked.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had truly enjoyed my first stay at the Vibe Hotel in Aug 2012 that's why I stayed at the same property in April 2013. The location is excellent, it's literally a stone's throw away from Cavill Avenue. Coles and Woolworth's (huge groceries) are right in front of the hotel. For the location alone, this hotel should be charging much higher rates but the great thing is they charge very very reasonably. The rooms are huge with a balcony, dining room, even a microwave and plates & utensils. Awesome place. My only rant is that they dont have wifi so I usually walk to McDonalds in Surfer's Paradise to get free wifi.
reviews.title: Perfect Location; Huge Rooms

reviews.text: The best place to stay in the GC. Close to shops, close to the bus stop (right outside), Oz Fair, & Broadbeach. Really nice place with accommodating staff. River views - the prefect place for RnR. This was our 2nd time back at the Vibe and WE WILL BE BACK! Wouldn't stay anywhere else. Thank you to all the hospitable staff - The McRaes NZ.
reviews.title: RnR 2012 & 2013
Aging glory - in 2013, how can any decent hotel not offer in room wifi!!
reviews.text: A once stylish hotel that is now showing its age, particularly on fixtures & fittings such as the bathroom & balcony areas.

reviews.title: alright
reviews.text: Moreover, the hotel has no Wireless service in rooms - even for a charge!! Only offering a wired service - in a generation of mobile devices, this is crazy.

description: You will love the convenience of staying right in the very heart of Surfers Paradise.Your Vibe Gold Coast hotel is centrally located in the midst of Gold Coast lifestyle, opposite the Chevron Renaissance Village, just a block from Cavill Avenue, the heart of the Gold Coast shopping district, and overlooking the picturesque Nerang River.We are perfectly placed for a leisurely stroll to Surfers Paradise beach, world-class shopping, fantastic nightlife, restaurants galore and lots of fun attractions…or you can just relax in comfort. The Gold Coast is brimming with fun filled activities including fishing charters, bungee jumping, motorbike tours, surfing lessons and even a few swings at one of the many leading golf courses at hand…and did we mention the beaches? And at the end of your busy day, return to your ideal Gold Coast hotel and relax in the comfort of your well appointed hotel room or suite, take a plunge in the pool or take an evening stroll along the promenade an soak up the atmosphere of the Gold Coast…enjoy the vibe at your Gold Coast hotel with personality…Vibe Hotel Gold Coast.
